2F344C6B989A436A95905FB89D1369D3.description: Make persuasive presentations that state a clear position in support of an argument or proposal, describe the points in support of the proposal and include supporting evidence

E8AF9821E9664562BD244F74BC9D8EC7.description: Provide oral summaries of articles and books that include the main ideas and the most significant details; state in own words, except when quoting directly from sources, demonstrate a complete understanding of sources, not just superficial details

EED7D5081C30435BAD998F08EC1DB61F.description: Deliver descriptive presentations that establish a clear point of view on the subject, establish the presenter’s relationship with the subject, contain effective, factual descriptions of appearance, concrete images, shifting perspectives and sensory details

002F566BB5EC4274B94880DB765E96F6.description: Give research presentations that pose relevant and concise questions about the topic, provide accurate information on the topic, include evidence generated through the formal research process, including the use of computer databases, magazines, newspapers, and dictionaries, citing reference sources appropriately

14EB612724324CBEB61CE9FA65377B21.description: Deliver narrative presentations that establish a context, plot, and point of view, including sensory details and specific language to develop the plot and character, use a range of narrative devices, including dialogue, tension or suspense and showing narrative action with movement, gestures, and expressions

96334DF3AC2D457294DCBF44D153C55E.description: Recite poems, scripture passages, sections of speeches, or dramatic soliloquies using voice modulation, tone and gestures expressively to enhance the meaning

908EA25ADAF44984AE49902BDD259F48.description: Identify the purpose of a presentation and apply appropriate presentation skills for the particular purpose

5E6CF18036274086BB3E80EE375F8859.description: Incorporate digital media and visual displays of data when helpful and in a manner that strengthens the presentation

0BF576F50D10463EA58886E92E9D82DD.description: Adapt speech to a variety of contexts and communicative tasks demonstrating command of formal English when indicated or appropriate

FE5A850E4F7248BD8E2C894708DCCDEF.description: Use adjustments in tone, volume and timing of speech and enunciation for effective presentations

9B461F110A344C3295B09C6D7199A572.description: Arrange supporting details, reasons, descriptions and examples effectively

83C267893D8B4800AF5CAF303E50BB38.description: Organize information to achieve particular purposes and to appeal to the background and interest of the audience

D0601F635CDB4A01AA92CFBCCC9E05D8.description: Present information emphasizing salient points with pertinent descriptions and details, using appropriate manners and speech, adequate volume, clear pronunciation, and use of visuals

C42B07E7AA0848CA88CECD8358EBC651.description: analyze the use of rhetorical devices, including rhythm and timing of speech, repetitive patterns and the use of onomatopoeia for intent and effect

3DD7BFA10A304F918BFCA840C4E9305E.description: evaluate a speaker’s or presenter’s reasoning and claims as well as the degree to which each claim is logically supported by the evidence provided

2853BF345DE34FA18BD0CFF8D76E35BE.description: provide helpful feedback to speakers concerning the coherence and logic of a speech’s content and delivery and its overall impact on the listener

5C5EE184A0C04F2685EBF8AF1C929019.description: analyze the effect on the viewer of images, text and sound in electronic journalism and identify the techniques used to achieve the effects

F3D615FCEF254AE2B58ED7EE95966958.description: determine the speaker’s attitude toward the subject

73FE293D05B14884B111FDA1B7754C92.description: determine the main ideas and supporting elements presented in oral, visual, or multimodal formats and explain how the information presented clarifies and contributes to a topic or issue under study

427389DD2B064783AC91B920FCC5F882.description: Analyze, evaluate, and interpret information presented in visual or multimodal formats

72B06348ADCA459488B1FE29EB9B49E9.description: Demonstrate respect for the views of others assessing new ideas against Catholic doctrine

6AB36CFB42644093904698A3908CDC6E.description: Take the views of others into account and, when warranted, modify personal view in light of the evidence presented

57AE0D5DBF86413CA5C252BED79DBA1F.description: Ensure a forum for the range of positions on an issue

230FB76781BD47ACA199A210737796C7.description: Advance a discussion by asking questions, responding precisely, and sharing factual knowledge and observations

23A5E0DEE6D341F199D6E395B03F237D.description: Cooperate with peers to set clear goals and deadlines

22E7496876D74295A1DF377C721BBA16.description: Ask questions to elicit information, including evidence to support the speaker’s claims and conclusions

9D054400924A433BBF79EBAE048BE54D.description: Prepare for discussions by completing reading or conducting research and explicitly draw on that material in discussion

D0814F34CD484E96B4C93160B7FC2734.description: Initiate and engage in group discussions on seventh grade topics and texts being studied in class

83E908D51F6D4FD1B1E718DA185C29B2.description:
Speaking and Listening: Comprehension and Collaboration
Students adjust their use of spoken language to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

5EC2F9AC46454313B3ECEAE2B6B531E3.description: Identify and properly use parallelism to present ideas in a series and items juxtaposed for emphasis

4450278220FE461B96757E2C00B1CEE7.description: Use phrases and clauses within sentences, paragraphs, and essays

67AB0625C72E451C8440B32B122D9028.description: Use a variety of complex transitions between sentences to build coherency within paragraphs

55E16BA0DC7B476DBFAEBBB818B95486.description: Identify passive and active voice, choosing active voice to produce clear, concise writing

C4DFF172BD33451697C81D80919443A1.description: Use effective coordination and subordination of ideas, including both main ideas and supporting details in single sentences to express complete thoughts

6C1E0A76ED094F76B69D0736F92BBB5B.description: Use simple, compound and complex sentences

F85B1891F65548398623D001F9BA1108.description: Use appropriate and varied sentence types to develop paragraphs

9C01C6EC47454FBF94B298998B531E59.description: Spell correctly, derivatives by applying the spelling of bases and affixes

530005ED18444FD3A78DE7E14731FDDB.description: Demonstrate the use of quotation marks

DA8B424BC80943ABAC539AA86E04E578.description: Identify and correctly use a hyphen, dash, parentheses, bracketing and semi-colon

F504B4A03FAE41C3BF379B1D0A731B16.description: Follow correct of use of commas when punctuating subordinate clauses

84455C3BCD46409290E83E8B35A6B05B.description: Observe conventions of capitalization, punctuation, and spelling

F65673D43BFD4E26BB5F8EFE2939229F.description: Identify and use modifiers such as adjective and adverb phrases; identify the words they modify

EE802641A2D84CCA91A76D887062BBAF.description: Identify and properly use present perfect, past perfect, and future perfect verb tenses

5A6419F245934D558AE33388304909E9.description: Identify and use relative pronouns, intensive/reflexive, possessive, demonstrative and indefinite pronouns

9E1AF6E60591458EA9A1C708EFCB02B2.description: Identify the antecedent of the pronoun and agreement of antecedent with the pronoun

C6A0073F1AC245C898E54320A472F5CA.description: Demonstrate understanding of and use of predicate nominative and predicate adjective (predicate nouns or subject complements)

F331DC1DAF354D82AAF24057AA4F1C81.description: Identify and use words in the possessive case, nominative case and objective case

3AC730A9649E4FDBBB9902143D9377B1.description: Use nouns of direct address and appositives

C66868355DAF4226999FA9C184EAAE56.description: Identify nouns with particular emphasis on concrete, abstract and collective nouns as a part of speech

ACA830EC7D364F46963912BCA809448A.description: Identify and define the functions of the parts of speech including adverbs, adjectives, interjections and conjunctions

F295D008E69D402EB33AA9690BEBF150.description: Observe conventions of grammar and usage in writing and speaking

8BF32CB2209F4CDB847F5CC0014D7355.description:
Grammar and Usage
Students adjust their use of spoken, written, and visual language (e.g., conventions, style, vocabulary) to communicate effectively with a variety of audiences and for different purposes.

EF20A15D31644FBCBE035ECDD0725A02.description: Use technology in an appropriate way,including the internet, to produce, publish and interact with others about writing, including linking to and citing online sources in order to avoid plagiarism.

244C6A11DBDF422AB41BACBA889FA252.description: Anticipate and address reader concerns and counterarguments

C60D47504C3544EFA52466B63DED1046.description: Describe the points in support of the proposition employing well-articulated evidence using effective emotional, logical and ethical appeals

6CC2C4C844E6406E9CA22A6FCE187B87.description: Write persuasive compositions that state a clear position on a proposition or proposal

43AF2A3B5E8E4B918EB2EFF52CD81314.description: Reference standards in Reading Literature and Informational Text- Comprehension, Response and Analysis (beginning on page 29)

7EECA31C7ACE41A09467067F08AD6BE5.description: Develop an interpretation that shows careful reading, understanding and insight

004DCCD762B748C7BD2F2EEF6207E3BF.description: Draw from text to support analysis and reflection describing what has been learned

3C532ADD3A5E4AE195500C7CB70341FF.description: Write in response to literary or informational source

A2E2471F592D451D873B143864DF6576.description: Provide basic bibliographic information using MLA or APA format

598D57993BE14189BF9FA67EF93564A3.description: Demonstrate the distinction between one’s own ideas from the ideas of others

2AF8CA875B0442BD90A9AE85E6F2565B.description: Demonstrate that sources have been evaluated for accuracy, bias and credibility

0DA1FFCD30DE42F196B4F18A9E87E614.description: Use a variety of resources and documents

65ED1BA518B84D66AAEA21149A970F1D.description: Participate in shared research and writing projects

E8930CDA1DC047FCA3983382A50D9302.description: Gather information from experience as well as print and digital resources, take notes on sources, categorize evidence, restate, summarize or paraphrase information

63EDB8F792DE4E10AFDC566A34567834.description: Perform focused research tasks that build knowledge through investigation of different aspects of a topic using several sources

D037EE9A2B40485F9DC355EABA483647.description: Use MLA (or APA) style for bibliography

0594DBBEA6D2473981DAE30354297625.description:
Identify the need for correct citation of
sources to avoid plagiarism

C7F4940E7D844F90BC1C1F1F8D38D9DC.description: Provide a conclusion that follows logically from the information or explanation presented

1E11D58DD59847B695EB2F75BEB8C321.description: Use straightforward language to create an objective style, appropriate for a reader seeking information

071A235F2FCD437394328813CDCA94F0.description: Use appropriate links and varied sentence structures to join and clarify ideas

DA10CD8C97EE4CDC9F899E9E04E83716.description: Develop the topic with relevant and accurate facts, definitions, concrete details, quotations, or other information and examples

6372EC5B17FA40009388613B6751EB42.description: Introduce a topic, state a thesis, organize information appropriate to the purpose, use strategies such as definition, classification, compare/ contrast, and cause/effect and offer evidence to support arguments and conclusions

182FAE3895024EA19B05B506DB2106A5.description: Write expository, informative/explanatory, descriptive, and technical texts

E27BC5B42A864020A9B7988869C9A6BD.description: Provide a satisfying conclusion that follows from events, experiences, or ideas

4572ECD142444763A7D5961921F0E313.description: Choose words and phrases to develop the events, experiences, and ideas precisely

3EF6BA1437184F4997150B0AD16FB7BA.description: Use a variety of transition words, phrases and clauses to convey sequence, shift from one time frame or setting to another, and/or show the relationships among the events and experiences

B3BCAEF6DB9241368BC38F26A0CDDE33.description: Write biographical, autobiographical and short stories that develop a standard plot line and point of view.

C479DA6B87874F8DA5FD8D37404EA767.description: Develop narrative elements (e.g., setting, event sequence, complex major and minor characters) using relevant sensory details and devices such as dialogue, suspense and the naming of narrative action

EE226FCFCAA34898843055E405D62613.description:
Engage and orient the reader by
establishing a context and point of view, and have an organized sequence of events or experiences

6186A465A85E49458D43559FF9E8A51A.description: Email and electronic notes that portray the appropriate tone

ACC837BACD7344F4972748400FDE14EC.description: Memos that portray the appropriate tone

1CD57EDC5E3749C6BBE7A9AA86D04530.description: Use symbols, pictures and charts to convey thoughts and meaning in a written document

CF6BAF6FB1FE408F800ED990D8C0A61B.description: Use varied word choices to make all types of writing interesting and more precise for the reader

268F65DA06F4417491AB6064BE82B8E1.description: Write for different purposes; information, persuasion, description, and to a specific audience or person, adjusting tone and style as necessary

5715DB739582402D84095C90A99BDC82.description: Support all statements and claims with anecdotes, descriptions, facts and statistics

F5335FC2D7C6452BB8DC97BE6F361D38.description: Write multi-paragraph informational text that engage the interest of the reader, state a clear purpose, develop the topic with supporting details and precise language, and conclude with a detailed summary linked to the purpose of the summary

7A3F3E3762FD425691ED9496701CF371.description: Compose paragraphs that are based on information, flow from reading and describe events and observations

45CB205D2C2044DFB87EEADB125366A2.description: Apply spelling and grammar rules to all written work

535BB21409C24FF29F8DE60D5D837AE9.description: Demonstrate the ability to use punctuation to affect meaning and flow in a written piece

6806093E953B477FA36418A7951D4DB2.description: Emphasize content as well as mechanics in written work

D7ACCC37C93C410292D68ECB60C871ED.description: Edit and proofread one’s own writing, as well as that of others, using an editing checklist or set of rules, with specific examples of corrections of frequent errors

1DC429DF1DC1439FB1F5A962CD8E0EC0.description: Use strategies of note-taking, outlining, and summarizing to impose structure on composition text

768BFBD6EDC44441A39BF539EBBCE4D6.description: Reflect on how well questions of purpose have been addressed and revise writing as needed

F12B1D0ADD4346B298BD9B20A2C1E393.description: Discuss ideas for writing, keep a list of ideas, and use a graphic organizer to plan writing

C6D3B4580D804859A22BF3D23CA4A6F8.description: Collaborate with adults and peers throughout the writing process to enhance ideas and techniques

FFC5EF6673854F52A63574EA7C994324.description: Revise writing to improve the organization and consistency of ideas within and between paragraphs to improve meaning and clarity.

C184007FF9F34043B05655A27AB12854.description: Engage in a writing process of planning, reviewing, revising, editing, rewriting, evaluating or trying a new approach

4ADAAB25EC7247CCB1C27D6F80D00BCC.description: Polished writing – engaged in the full writing process (plan, research, reflect, revise; first draft, second draft, final)

5AEBEDC4575D4C1EB2E126B7F9916D82.description: Readable writing – intended for an audience (essay test question, assignment –short response answers)

02DEEF7549144ABB83B730A1BA0884AE.description: Provisional writing – brief, daily writing that supports learning (brainstorming, spontaneous, routine tasks)

EDA00EBF710C4460AE9D3D2B926D20B7.description: Write routinely for a range of tasks, purposes and audiences, over short and extended time frames

8B99204B964142B190AE88132881DABC.description: Produce grade appropriate coherent, clear, and legible writing in which organization, development, substance and style are appropriate to task, purpose, and audience

AA709893D10444B4BB511B877DDCA3D3.description:
Writing – Processes and Features
Students employ a wide range of strategies as they write and use different writing process elements appropriately to communicate with different audiences for a variety of purposes.

72FB4DB2BC8F4B51A57E1AD06CADE1C9.description: Self-select appropriate texts for research and personal reading

A703B24EE79A49C283B084EE175968F1.description: Expand the use of reference materials for gathering information and develop rubric for evaluating validity of sources from web sources.

35A3FC0A61CC4909900FA73A68AE54C3.description: Analyze where two or more texts provide conflicting information on the same subject and determine whether the texts disagree on matters of fact or on matters of interpretation of those facts

72FBCAD10AC9453F9C1FB3FE0C8080BA.description: Assess the similarities and differences between two or more texts on the same subject.

05C7A29E7715475099AD989343E8AB6B.description: Identify the stated and unstated premises of an argument and explain how they contribute to the conclusion reached

49F590D1F4E746FE9C8B5EA957FA802C.description: Distinguish among fact, opinion, propaganda, and reasoned judgment presented

219E19CC67AD4CF488077A508717A4D1.description: Analyze how the method of delivery affects the impact of the information being portrayed

F6957500EFB94AFDA75EB5CFF682D73E.description: Compare and contrast the accounts of a subject in different mediums (e.g. person’s life story told in print, video, or multimedia)

8BD13999427642C5B6CF6C56E6FA55CE.description: Extend awareness of world cultures and historical perspectives through diverse texts, including first-person materials, accounts of historical events, documents and historical fiction.

E749EC3EE5BC4144AA0D324E444C9244.description: Compare and contrast the works of various authors

7AF5D88F2DA2415181CB5EBE45247801.description: Compare reviews of literary works and determine what influences the reviewer

D0CAB43A64D0466FB50F46C4AF59FFCA.description: Evaluate, critique, and interpret a variety of literature from different eras and cultures and authors

C709B26CDDB043BE84A8C30E347F1C2B.description: Describe in detail how an author introduces, illustrates, and elaborates a key idea in a text (e.g. through example or anecdotes)

E14B50F3EFF64FD9B9B8E39D1E00AAFC.description: Determine the causes or reasons that link different events, ideas, or information in a text, drawing on key details

8946DD3BC85549D49C96F8519CF40E9D.description: Identify and explain the effects of common literary devices such as symbolism, imagery, or metaphor in a variety of texts

48D64B8913234B7FA765E7B7B4201E2C.description: Interpret figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases, as they are used in text, to explain meaning

8E056587197D4328B9CBEFBD51019D2C.description: Analyze how two or more themes or central ideas in a text relate to one another, drawing on key details

B8469E290B6D404A98C4941A7EAF076A.description: Identify and analyze features and themes conveyed through characters, actions and images

A0FC31F510FE48B3A41B8095CDE5981C.description: Analyze how particular lines of dialogue or specific incidents in the story or drama reveal aspects of character, or provoke a decision

D11D2E323F0F479C938AB4C182EC8F24.description: Identify events that advance the plot and determine how each event explains past or present action or foreshadows future action

4E7CF2B00FF54D218BF8C530DB184D79.description: Describe how a story’s plot unfolds (in a series of episodes or as a problem to be solved) as well as how characters adapt or change as they move toward a resolution

F71B436E5C074F0596F49525C4C06576.description: Apply Catholic values, virtues, Catholic Social Teachings in evaluation of literary themes and plots

D186A5A9FE5E43FFB545448519E1E56D.description: Interpret text using background knowledge, literary elements and inferences.

1BC5EB050DB8455DBB7A641A627EA6D8.description: Student will read a variety of texts and genres to build an interest in leisure, academic, and informational reading

24725D01CEDD468090F8CF06566DF11F.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Text - Comprehension, Response, and Analysis
Students read a wide range of print and non-print texts to build an understanding of texts, of themselves, and of the cultures of the United States and the world; to acquire new information; to respond to the needs and demands of society and the workplace; and for personal fulfillment. Among these texts are fiction and nonfiction, classic and contemporary works, and literature from many periods

BAF4F1FA30044F5390DAD13D115CA7B6.description: Assess the adequacy, accuracy, and appropriateness of the author’s evidence to support claims and assertions, noting instances of bias and stereotyping

BFDD3E54F7CB4A7C9DEC2B864660FC6F.description: Expository critique - Assess evidence of nonfiction and informational literature

EB1A7A09F5614E0EBA649B7323ACFA92.description: Clarify an understanding of texts by creating outlines, notes, diagrams, summaries, or reports

91E723B8D66F40E3A7BD1B329222D038.description: Connect and clarify main ideas by identifying their relationships to multiple sources and related topics

84ED4B797C904C59B3563A1D524F1FE0.description: Draw conclusions, make reasonable statements, inferences, and predictions about a text, supporting the conclusions, statements with evidence from the text

52508535DCBE4C43A11ABF49FAD09224.description: Compare the point of from which different stories are narrated, including the difference between first and third person narrations

F7E5235006934D7099C40ADB59DBD44F.description: Determine how the author’s point of view influences the cultural context of a text

B1CDBA45E80441B9B2B506E04B40A2F5.description: Identify how the author presents the points of view of different characters, including their different reactions to the same person or events

E7F9CAA701F34FF096BBE64FEFAAB601.description: Identify and trace the development of an author’s argument, point of view or perspective

CE37EA0BDE594EBCB2A8E6D2A7038F26.description: Determine point of view and cultural context on which media is portrayed

0416C935516D4F69BC97463481890B16.description: Describe how any given sentence, paragraph, section or chapter fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of ideas

F432E223951647D1B04C0511DD77DFAA.description: Explain how a sentence, chapter, scene or stanza fits into the overall structure of a text and contributes to the development of the plot or themes

585F6CA6622F4BAB9EC0D1C9E7F420BE.description: Identify how text structure affects meaning, including chronological order, order of importance and special order

0343278E778047EC902242789E3B9AAA.description: Describe the structure an author uses to organize specific text

3E866B15149F4F2CABE568E243587540.description: Analyze how structure impacts the meaning of a poem

6F3540ACE98E46FE97DCF10E995864FF.description: Explore literature from diverse cultural backgrounds

15702EF693C641F8A66F0F399F55B77B.description: Explain how author’s purpose for writing influences the contents of the selection (e.g., inform, entertain, persuade)

FE0AD728728F497FB6ED5F0512BE57C0.description: Discuss the purposes and characteristics of different forms of written text, such as short story, novel, novella and essay

ABAF49AA34F14EFF82721256B3FAA34B.description: Distinguish major categories and features of literary genre (e.g. stories from poems, fiction from non-fiction)

2FAFC93D68A9444DB0E696727C17C16F.description: Understand and analyze the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

E923F7C0CE664F058387794C8F57BF37.description: Utilize the structural features of media and use the features to obtain information

1CFD4232516445CD8C302CC2B2F946E8.description:
Reading Literature and Informational Texts - Craft and Structure
Students apply knowledge of language structure, language conventions (e.g., spelling and punctuation), media techniques, figurative language, and genre to create, critique, and discuss print and non-print texts.

2A5C4FDF45D4428D80AA7B9699982EE3.description: Apply idioms, analogies, similes, metaphors, alliteration, hyperbole, onomatopoeia, and personification

EF88B9D08C534D279B8085148080F8C9.description: Describe, in detail, a specific word choice and its impact on meaning and tone.

54A5CCE52A774BE0823EBACC5153EFA9.description: Interpret the figurative and connotative meanings of words and phrases as they are used in a text.

79DFB771743648E3A0957B51CB5D2621.description: Identify analogies: word and synonym, word and antonym, part and whole

5BCD4CEF02FF48C391B0485A2A66C9E2.description: Distinguish a word from other words with similar denotations but different connotations

972C7D12DB0D440EA2363357A4696FAB.description: Trace the network of uses and meaning that different words have and the interrelationships among the meanings and uses

D9507BDDDAE84D67AF3FA41CB862486B.description: Apply the etymologies of frequently used foreign words in English speaking and writing

02A37966CC9042CBAF25622AE1DAC8DD.description: Interpret various figures of speech (e.g., allegory) relevant to particular texts

7B89CC0D576F4B8EA5E5A4967C50D9F0.description: Verify the preliminary determination of a word’s meaning (e.g., by checking the inferred meaning in context or looking up a word in the dictionary)

8BBA605C31D04E668942BD9358B13CDF.description: Use known prefixes, root words, and suffixes as a clue to the meaning of an unknown word with the same root (e.g., belligerent,bellicose,rebel)

44A7192441C94B3795EB95CC673C7348.description: Determine or clarify the meaning of unknown or multiple-meaning words through the use if one or more strategies, such as understanding how the word is used in a sentence; analyzing the word’s sounds, spelling, and meaningful parts; and consulting glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital

FED8D654FE724289B337F6E136E0C2B3.description: Determine word meanings (based on grade seven reading)

FC7865CE329A4AF6B6D3802067D374BB.description:
Vocabulary Development and Word Analysis
Students apply a wide range of strategies to comprehend, interpret, evaluate, and appreciate texts. They draw on their prior experience, their interactions with other readers and writers, their knowledge of word meaning and of other texts, their word identification strategies and understanding textual features (e.g. sound-letter correspondence, sentence structure, context, graphics).
